a.n: Mizikopéyi Creole Big Band - Tropiques Atrium

p.k: Singer Tony Chasseur and pianist Thierry Vaton created the French big band MizikOpéyi in 2006. MizikOpéyi offers a mix of traditional and popular Caribbean rhythms and Afro-Caribbean melodies, wrapped in jazzy big band arrangements.
p.d: Singer Tony Chasseur and pianist Thierry Vaton created the French big band MizikOpéyi in 2006. MizikOpéyi offers a mix of traditional and popular Caribbean rhythms and Afro-Caribbean melodies, wrapped in jazzy big band arrangements. Composed of 17 musicians, the big band mimics the great New Orleans jazz ensemble tradition, incorporating a dozen horns in its brass section. The band's repertoire consists of contemporary French West Indian music from Martinique and Guadeloupe, in genres such as Zouk, beguine, mazurka, and kompa.
